channel.title: Networking Problem
channel.description:
Alright so basically I'm trying to portforward port 80 (portforward.com won't work for this..).
Well.. I have a unique Modem.. my modem only has one ethernet port but it has a portforward page..
Well, I have 2 routers 1 that doesn't have a port forward page (not using, but was before) and 1 that does (using it atm)
Well this is the setup..
[IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/2qd5v0p.png[/img]
What I have is I port forward the modem to the router and port forward the router to the server using
Modem (portforward to 192.168.1.93 (using port 80))
Router (portforward to 192.168.0.104 (using port 80))
Yet no one can connect...

item.title: Networking Problem
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:11, topic:299094”]whats the brand of the modem? netcomm?[/quote]It’s fixed, I had to change the iptables.

Read full topic

item.title: Networking Problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Then you have some firewall blocking port 80 on the server itself from being accessed from the network. Have to fix that first before you worry about port forwarding.

Read full topic

item.title: Networking Problem
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:299094”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=395449.msg2938213#msg2938213 date=1251686833]

I wonder if the servers not online or if theres a firewall on the distro im using idk…

Try accessing it from one of the other PCs on the network.
[/quote]Dont work

Then your problem is not port forwarding, your server doesn’t work. Try localhost on the host computer to start out with.[/quote]Localhost works…

[quote=“la­wl, post:7, topic:299094”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=395449.msg2938236#msg2938236 date=1251688202]

I wonder if the servers not online or if theres a firewall on the distro im using idk…

Try accessing it from one of the other PCs on the network.
[/quote]Dont work

Then your problem is not port forwarding, your server doesn’t work. Try localhost on the host computer to start out with.

tbh, i bet what he did is he tried to access the external ip from another comp, not the internal ip as you meant. you should be more specific when dealing with people of lesser knowledge[/quote]I used internal ip, ass.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:299094”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=395449.msg2938241#msg2938241 date=1251688668]

I wonder if the servers not online or if theres a firewall on the distro im using idk…

Try accessing it from one of the other PCs on the network.
[/quote]Dont work

Then your problem is not port forwarding, your server doesn’t work. Try localhost on the host computer to start out with.

tbh, i bet what he did is he tried to access the external ip from another comp, not the internal ip as you meant. you should be more specific when dealing with people of lesser knowledge

Could be.

At the thread starter, try to access http://192.168.0.104 from one of your other computers.[/quote]did.

Read full topic

Then your problem is not port forwarding, your server doesn’t work. Try localhost on the host computer to start out with.

tbh, i bet what he did is he tried to access the external ip from another comp, not the internal ip as you meant. you should be more specific when dealing with people of lesser knowledge[/quote]

Could be.

At the thread starter, try to access http://192.168.0.104 from one of your other computers.

item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:2, topic:299094”]use dmz to open up the router[/quote]Wasn’t sure if you wanted me to set the DMZ to 192.168.1.254 (modem) or the server… I tried both, didn’t work.

EDIT: Well, I tried the router without a router page… still didn’t work… I wonder if the servers not online or if theres a firewall on the distro im using idk…

Read full topic
